Sacred Hindu Wedding Tradition

Saptapadi - Seven Sacred Steps

The seven steps in Hindu marriage ceremonies represent a spiritual journey and foundational vows for a lifelong partnership

üçΩÔ∏è
Step 1
Current

Nourishment & Provision

"Together we shall provide for our family"

The first step is a promise to provide for the family's needs and welfare, ensuring sustenance and prosperity.

üí™
Step 2

Strength & Well-being

"Together we shall develop physical, mental and spiritual strength"

Commitment to physical and mental health, offering courage and support to each other in all circumstances.

üí∞
Step 3

Prosperity & Wealth

"Together we shall work towards increasing our wealth"

Vowing to work together for financial stability and prosperity, building a secure future.

üòä
Step 4

Happiness & Harmony

"Together we shall acquire happiness and harmony"

A pledge for mutual love, trust, and shared joys, creating a harmonious household.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶
Step 5

Family & Responsibility

"Together we shall raise strong and virtuous children"

Promise to care for children, family, and contribute positively to society.

üå∏
Step 6

Health & Seasons

"Together we shall live through all seasons of life"

A commitment to face life's seasons - joys and sorrows - and support each other's health.

ü§ù
Step 7

Friendship & Loyalty

"Together we shall remain lifelong companions"

The final vow of eternal friendship, loyalty, unity, and companionship for seven lifetimes.

Journey of Eternal Union

These seven sacred steps, taken around the holy fire (Agni), bind the couple for seven lifetimes. Each step represents a promise, transforming two individuals into united life partners with divine blessings. Together, they commit to building a life of mutual support, shared values, and eternal companionship.

The Sacred Fire Ceremony

In the presence of the sacred fire (Agni), the couple takes seven steps together, each representing a sacred vow for their journey ahead. This ancient ritual symbolizes spiritual completeness and divine blessing.
